That's also what I'm slightly afraid of lol people judging my commit messages

elements.text: That's also what I'm slightly afraid of lol people judging my commit messages

text: I would not worry about it at all, like people assume job interviewers are going to pour over every inch of their life. They don't. In some cases they barely even read your resume

elements.text: I would not worry about it at all, like people assume job interviewers are going to pour over every inch of their life. They don't. In some cases they barely even read your resume

text: Sure be professional, maintain good practices, it's a good habbit, but it's OSS, just do your best to write good code. edit - oh yea and have fun and make cool stuff

elements.text: Sure be professional, maintain good practices, it's a good habbit, but it's OSS, just do your best to write good code. edit - oh yea and have fun and make cool stuff

text:
When I look at candidates GitHub profiles, I’ll always take a peek at commit messages but don’t factor that into anything.

Just the quality of code they write.

elements.text:

text: I find it very annoying that you're not allowed empty commit message (or maybe that's just magit, I have to configure it)

elements.text: I find it very annoying that you're not allowed empty commit message (or maybe that's just magit, I have to configure it)

text: Why would you want to have an empty commit? They’re useful for quickly seeing what changes are in it
